cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay will explore and analyze the origins of urban legends.
The essay will explore and analyze the impact of urban legends on society.
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: impact of urban legends on society

args.canonical_rel_desc: A document or essay examines, evaluates, or analyzes a specific topic, phenomenon, or question as part of its thematic scope.
args.justification: Both relations link the same subject type (this essay) to conceptual topics (origins/impact of urban legends) and describe what the essay will analyze as its scope, so a single predicate capturing a document's analytical focus is appropriate.
args.remark: Used as a generic document-to-topic analytical/aboutness relation.

args.justification: Both relations express what the essay is about in terms of its analytical scope (origins and impacts of urban legends), fitting a class for document-to-topic thematic/scope links.

The connection is that the essay is associated with (is about and analyzes) these topics; it is not compositional, causal, or temporal but a thematic association between a document and its subject matter.
